skill.name: diffdock
skill.description: Diffusion-based molecular docking. Predict protein-ligand binding poses from PDB/SMILES, confidence scores, virtual screening, for structure-based drug design. Not for affinity prediction.
skill.summary: Diffusion-based molecular docking. Predict protein-ligand binding poses from PDB/SMILES, confidence ...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Pure Python utility scripts for scientific computing. No network calls, no credential access, no code execution vulnerabilities. Scripts validate dependencies, prepare batch inputs, and analyze docking results locally.

content.value_statement: Drug discovery requires understanding how molecules bind to protein targets. DiffDock uses diffusion models to predict 3D binding poses from protein structures and ligand SMILES, enabling structure-based drug design workflows.
actual_capabilities: Predict 3D ligand binding poses from protein structures or sequences
Generate multiple sampled poses per protein-ligand pair
Compute confidence scores for prediction reliability
Validate inputs and analyze results with provided scripts
limitations: Does NOT predict binding affinity (requires additional scoring tools)
Not designed for protein-protein docking or large peptides
First run pre-computes lookup tables (2-5 minutes)

use_cases.title: Lead compound optimization
use_cases.description: Predict binding poses for candidate molecules to guide medicinal chemistry decisions

use_cases.title: Virtual screening
use_cases.description: Screen compound libraries against protein targets to identify potential hits

use_cases.title: Binding site analysis
use_cases.description: Explore how different ligands interact with protein binding sites

prompt_templates.title: Basic docking
prompt_templates.prompt: Dock the ligand SMILES [LIGAND_SMILES] to protein [PROTEIN_FILE_OR_SEQUENCE] using DiffDock. Run with default parameters and report the top 3 predicted poses with their confidence scores.

prompt_templates.title: Virtual screening
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a virtual screen using DiffDock. Prepare a batch CSV from [LIGAND_CSV] and [PROTEIN_FILE], process all complexes, and identify the top 10 highest confidence predictions.

prompt_templates.title: Ensemble docking
prompt_templates.prompt: Dock [LIGAND_SMILES] to multiple protein conformations in [ENSEMBLE_DIR]. Generate 20 samples per conformation and analyze which conformation yields the highest confidence binding pose.

prompt_templates.title: Results analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the DiffDock results in [RESULTS_DIR]. Generate a summary of confidence score distributions, identify high-confidence predictions, and export the top predictions to a CSV file.

output_examples.input: Dock aspirin (SMILES: CC(=O)Oc1ccccc1C(=O)O) to a kinase protein structure
output: Binding pose shows hydrogen bond to hinge region
Results saved to results/ directory as SDF files

best_practices: Verify environment setup with scripts/setup_check.py before running large jobs
Generate multiple samples (10-40) for robust predictions
Combine DiffDock poses with scoring functions like GNINA for affinity assessment
Visualize and validate predictions in molecular viewers before downstream analysis
anti_patterns: Using confidence scores as binding affinity measures
Expecting accurate results on CPU without GPU
Skipping visual inspection of predicted poses
Using for protein-protein docking instead of specialized tools

faq.question: Does DiffDock predict binding affinity?
faq.answer: No, DiffDock predicts binding poses and confidence scores only. Use scoring functions like GNINA or MM/GBSA for affinity prediction.

faq.question: What input formats are supported?
faq.answer: Proteins: PDB files or amino acid sequences. Ligands: SMILES strings, SDF files, or MOL2 files.

faq.question: Can I run this on CPU?
faq.answer: Yes, but performance will be 10-100x slower. GPU is strongly recommended for practical use.

faq.question: How many samples should I generate?
faq.answer: Default is 10. Increase to 20-40 for difficult cases or when exploring multiple binding modes.

faq.question: What do confidence scores mean?
faq.answer: Scores above 0 indicate high confidence, -1.5 to 0 is moderate, below -1.5 is low. Higher means model is more certain about the pose.

faq.question: How does this compare to traditional docking?
faq.answer: DiffDock uses deep learning for better accuracy on challenging cases. Traditional methods like Vina are faster but may underperform on flexible ligands.
